description:
Metroid: Zero Mission is a retelling of the first Metroid on NES. Relive Samus' first adventure on planet Zebes with
new areas, items, enemies, and story! Logic based on Metroid: Zero Mission Randomizer by Biosp4rk and Dragonfangs,
used with permission.

0.1.0.description:
The Zero Mission apworld is now ready to play. Here's a brief overview:

## Goal
Currently, you only need to defeat Mecha Ridley. Other goals will be added later, but for now we encourage you to defeat Mother Brain first.

## Options
Some of the more important ones are:
- Chozodia Access: If set to closed, the power bomb doors in Crateria will be locked until Mother Brain is defeated
- Unknown Items Always Usable: On by default. Allows you to use the Plasma Beam, Space Jump, and Gravity Suit as soon as you obtain them.
- Layout Patches: Modifies the following rooms to reduce softlocks:
  - Hallway to Long Beam: The three beam blocks never reform, so you don't need long beam, missiles, or bombs to leave.
  - Norfair elevator from Brinstar: The elevator goes to the bottom of the room so you don't need items or wall jumps to leave.
  - Crateria Morph Ball tunnel to Plasma Beam: Adds beam blocks so you can escape if you go in without Hi-Jump or Bombs.
  - Crateria waterway between gunship and Norfair elevator: Changes Speed Booster blocks to beam blocks so you can always get back to Norfair.
  - Kraid escape shaft: Changes some Speed Booster blocks to beam blocks so you can get back up.
- Logic options: Whether to consider consider wall jumps, infinite bomb jumps, heat runs, and lava dives in logic.

## Differences from vanilla
- Deorem will attack you if you have Super Missiles but not Missiles.
- Power Bombs are usable without having regular Bombs.
- The Gravity Suit does not give heat resistance, and the Varia Suit is not given to you for completing the ruins test in Chozodia. (Currently the ruins test does forcibly equip Gravity Suit, to be fixed in a later release)
- You can toggle items on the Samus screen by pressing Select.
- You can warp to your starting location in Brinstar by holding L and R while selecting No when asked to save at a save station or the gunship.
- The invincible geron in Norfair that blocks you without Power Grip is removed.
- Chozo Statue hints are disabled for now, so they all start seated to not block your way
- The in-game timer counts a second as 60 frames instead of 64. The escape timer currently does not have this fix.
0.1.0.title: 0.1.0: Metroid: Zero Mission

0.1.1.description:
## Additions
- Client now sends your current room to be used in the future by the tracker

## Changes
- Sends less event flags for trackers. More won't be removed, this was just fine because @ladybunne's tracker doesn't use them yet
- Client should send game clear sooner when entering the ship in Chozodia

## Bug fixes
- Adjusted multiworld receiving in game to hopefully freeze Samus or crash less often
- Fixed Bombs being able to be activated without the item
- Fixed Chozo ruins test equipping Gravity Suit without the item
- Fixed a dark room in Chozodia displaying incorrectly
- Fixed softlock from beating Chozo ruins test and then Mother Brain
- Fixed Gravity Suit becoming immune to heated rooms when submerged in lava
- Fixed graphical glitches from receiving items in Chozo ruins test boss room
- Fixed generation failure from a Power Grip logic check
- Logic fixes for:
  - Brinstar upper pillar and behind bombs
  - Kraid boss and acid worm
  - Ridley left shaft access
  - Chozodia access from Crateria
0.1.1.title: 0.1.1: Bug fixes just in time for the Poptracker test

0.1.2.description:
## Additions
- Layout patches:
  - Added escape from Brinstar Top Missile room without bombs
  - Bomb block locking Brinstar Under Bridge never reforms

## Changes
- Tweaks to logic rules:
  - Brinstar hives
  - Kraid upper right
  - Norfair shaft to Ridley
  - Chozodia access from Crateria
  - Chozo ruins test and Mecha Ridley

## Bug fixes
- Logic updated to match Gravity Suit no longer giving heat resistance
- Fixed sound issues when collecting or receiving an item during a shinespark
- Fixed hardlock when defeating Chozo ruins test without Gravity Suit
- Fixed game crash when receiving an item from a player using an alias
0.1.2.title: 0.1.2: Picking softlocks and stomping bugs

0.1.3.description:
## Additions
- Item groups:
  - Major Items
  - Beams
  - Upgrades (major items other than beams)
  - Missiles (regular and supers)
- Location groups:
  - Brinstar, Kraid, Ridley, Tourian, Crateria (correspond to areas in-game)
  - Upper Norfair (area including Hi-Jump, Ice Beam, and the Crateria elevator)
  - Lower Norfair (anything accessed by going behind Hi-Jump or taking the shortcut to Ridley)
  - Chozo Ruins (upper left area of Chozodia near the door and ruins test)
  - Mother Ship (mechanical side of Chozodia and the crash site)
  - Chozo Statues, Freestanding Items, Energy Tanks

## Changes
- Modified graphics for Brinstar Top Missile layout patch (@Paperkoopa)
- Made multiworld receiving more lenient. Most notably you can receive items during escape in some rooms.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.1.2...0.1.3
0.1.3.title: 0.1.3: QoL improvements

0.2.0.description:
This one sure took a while. We got a little scope-crept, I think. In any case, it's here now.

The *main* focus of this update was to iterate on some of the original systems from the first release to make them more consistent and stable. Logic rules and item patching have been greatly improved with far fewer issues. The client has also been updated to make the AP experience nicer and more tolerant of something going wrong with the server.

Some of these patch notes may seem familiar to you, and that's because 0.1.3 accidentally was built from the dev branch for this update. I never got around to correcting that release since that version seemed pretty stable.

## Additions
- Item sprite support for Metroid Prime and Super Metroid Map Rando.
  - Added custom sprites for all Super Metroid items and some Metroid Prime items.

### Options
- Goal
  - Mecha Ridley: The door to Mecha Ridley is always accessible
  - Major Bosses: The door to Mecha Ridley is locked until Kraid, Ridley, Mother Brain, and the Chozo Ghost are defeated.
- Start with Maps: Start the game with all map stations visited.
- Logic Difficulty
  - When enabled, logic can expect you to perform more niche techniques or perform combat with more limited resources.
  - A few examples of these tricks are entering hidden tunnels, jump extends, and Acid Worm skip.
- Tricky Shinesparks
  - When enabled, logic can expect more difficult or unintuitive Shinesparks for traversal.
  - Examples include collecting Brinstar Ceiling E-Tank with a spark and accessing the Norfair larva room without Wave Beam.
  - Locations such as Chozodia Chozo Ghost Area Long Shinespark and Crateria Landing Site Ballspark that require difficult shinesparks normally are not affected by this option.
- Layout Patches
  - Ridley ball cannon room: allows escape from the bottom without needing to use the ball cannon
  - Crateria landing site access from Power Grip tower: widens the gap between the pillar and ceiling so it can be hi- or wall-jumped into.
- Fast Item Banners: The messages displayed when getting an item can be closed faster and never open the equipment screen.
- Remote Items
  - Receive items from your own world, allowing co-op play.
  - If you game-over or reset, the items lost in the save reload will be returned to you.
  - Even with this option enabled, you can still play offline, but your items will not be given back.

## Changes
- Overhauled the way items are handled by both the game and the client. This fixes a lot of jank in the original implementation.
- Overhauled logic definitions using a new system. Many of the rules themselves have also been changed.
- Changed the names of many locations
- IBJ In Logic option
  - True and False replaced with None, Vertical Only, and Horizontal And Vertical
- Client changes:
  - Can now sync your items to the server state, regardless of the new Remote Items option
  - When you game-over or reset, remote items that have already been sent to you once will not show a message again
  - Items sent from your own slot (e.g. by !getitem cheat) no longer show your own name
  - When receiving multiple items at once, tanks will be grouped together and added to your capacity in bulk.
- The patcher will now fail if the client won't be able to read the patched ROM.

## Bug fixes
- Fixed strange death link behavior.
- Death links can now be received from other players in the same slot.
- Fixed generator failures with Unknown Items Always Usable turned off.
- Fixed a bunch of other bugs that I can't remember.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.1.3...0.2.0
0.2.0.title: 0.2.0 - Big Reworks

0.2.0-pre1.description:
In addition to the prior pre-releases previously uploaded to Discord (and mistakenly released here, I never fixed the AP world download), this incorporates the client update with remote items option and the logic rework.

Full list of features:
- Reworked location checking code
- Reworked logic
- Renamed several locations for better clarity
- Added a Goal option to require defeating Mother Brain before beating the seed
- Added a Remote Items option, which allows co-op play of a seed
- Added a Fast Item Banners option
- Patcher can now tolerate patches generated with slightly different versions of the AP world
- Added support for Metroid Prime and Super Metroid Map Randomizer for non-local item sprites
- Added several custom sprites for Super Metroid and Metroid Prime items
- Client now synchronizes your received items with the server
- When receiving several items at once, repeated items (such as missile expansions) will be folded into one message to save time

More documentation on the features added will be written when the full release of 0.2.0 is made.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.1.3...0.2.0-pre1
0.2.0-pre1.title: 0.2.0-pre1: Logic and client overhaul

0.2.0-pre2.description:
- Allows Deorem's thorns to drop Super Missile ammo
- Fixes patching fail when "Unknown Items Always Usable" is turned off
- Fixes client crash when syncing Energy Tanks
- Fixes palette in the room with Chozodia Ceiling Near Map Station

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.2.0-pre1...0.2.0-pre2
0.2.0-pre2.title: 0.2.0-pre2

0.2.0-pre3.description:
- Added Chozodia Access option to slot data
- Fixed patching failure when turning off Unknown Items Always Usable
- Fixed an item message box appearing when reloading a save with Remote Items on
- Fixed strange behavior when receiving death links
- Fixed broken NES Metroid unlock message

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.2.0-pre2...0.2.0-pre3
0.2.0-pre3.title: 0.2.0-pre3

0.2.0-pre4.description:
- Changed the way items sync in a way that hopefully prevents the client deactivating items you've just acquired
- Modified the patching process to be more strict about the generator and patcher running different versions of the apworld. This should prevent a problem where the ROM would patch successfully, but the client would be unable to recognize it.

Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.2.0-pre3...0.2.0-pre4
0.2.0-pre4.title: 0.2.0-pre4

0.2.1.description:
Been a minute, hasn't it? Work on 0.3.0 is starting again, so here's a quick one to catch up on the past couple of months' updates.

## Additions
- Item sprite support for Super Junkoid and Super Metroid Subversion (thanks @Scrungip)

## Changes
- Various logic changes, most significant are new ways to upper Crateria and a new advanced method to collect Ridley Bomb Puzzle with PBs

## Bug fixes
- Fixed palette in Chozodia Bomb Maze room (thanks @Paperkoopa)
- Fixed reversed names for Norfair Behind Lower Super Missile Door Left and Right

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.2.0...0.2.1

0.2.2.description:
## Changes
- Changed handling for the morph ball placement option. Notably, this allows AP's built-in "early locations" framework to apply Brinstar First Missile and Long Beam instead of Morph Ball if you turn on early morph, which opens the possibility for e.g. plandoing Power Grip to be early.

## Bug fixes
- Corrected access rule for Crateria Power Grip.
- Prevented death links from activating while the game is saving, which could save you at 0 energy and softlock the save file.
- Fixed Progression+Useful items appearing as Useful instead of Progression.
- Fixed problems when plando-ing missiles and super missiles. As a result of the change, one additional missile tank is considered progression.
- 
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.2.1...0.2.2

0.2.3.description:
- Adjusted capitalization for a few location names
- Various logic changes:
  - Fixed Brinstar Bomb and Behind Bomb locations being considered accessible without missiles
  - Bottom of Norfair is connected to lower right shaft: Notably makes those checks and LN accessible without screw, speed, or bombs
  - Added a new method of collecting Norfair Right Shaft Bottom and a new advanced method for Norfair Bomb Trap with power bombs
  - Adjusted some regional boundaries in Ridley
  - Improved logic rules for Ridley SW puzzles, Ice Beam access, and Kraid ziplines
  - Other small fixes

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.2.2...0.2.3

0.3.0.description:
This one was a long time coming.

- Changed the "Planet Zebes..." intro text to show information about the seed, AP world, and your goal
- Several super missile and power bomb tanks are now considered useful
- You can now receive items in boss rooms as long as the boss is dead
- You can now warp to start from the Zero Suit section, which will return your Power Suit and un-kill Mother Brain
- Added options:
  - Game difficulty
  - Plasma Beam hint, which changes the Mother Brain story text to hint the location of the Plasma Beam
  - Buff power bomb drops
  - Logic difficulty has been split between navigation and combat, and there are more options in each category
  - Layout patches have a new option to choose a specific set of patches
  - Skip Tourian opening cutscenes
  - Elevator speed
- Added dots to the area map to help track collected locations in-game
- Chozodia is now always in the post-ruins test state unless you're in the Zero Suit section, and logic has been changed to match
- Skipped the pause screen opening when defeating the Chozo Ruins Test
- Halved the time cutoffs for ending gallery rewards (2/4 hours -> 1/2 hours)
- Various other changes and fixes to logic
- Improved the error message for AP world version mismatches
- Starting NES Metroid no longer crashes the game
- The patcher now accepts the Wii U Virtual Console ROM, but be warned you will encounter severe graphical glitches in Chozodia that haven't been figured out yet

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.2.3...0.3.0
**Basepatch Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/MZM-Archipelago/compare/a3d6711...7472929

  - Layout patches have a new option to choose a specific set of patches
  - Skip Tourian opening cutscenes
  - Eleveator speed

0.3.0-pre1.title: 0.3.0 Prerelease 1

0.3.0-pre2.description:
This release fixes a bug that would cause the client to crash when collecting local items in 0.3.0-pre1. There are also a few small logic changes, mostly in Chozodia and Kraid.

### Use this prerelease with caution, as there is still a known issue with this release when Unknown Items Always Usable is set to False. After completing the ruins test, your unknown items previously acquired will activate, but will still be untranslated in the menu and cannot be toggled. Receiving an Unknown Item from the server may not activate it correctly even after the ruins test, which may leave the game unbeatable if that item is Plasma Beam.

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.3.0-pre1...0.3.0-pre2
0.3.0-pre2.title: 0.3.0-Prerelease 2

0.3.0-pre2a.description:
This *should* fix the unknown item problems for good if they could still occur in prerelease 2. The base patch was completely recompiled to avoid a bad build causing any more issues.

This also fixes a small bug I noticed where savewarping as ZSS wouldn't return Chozodia to the post-ruins test state.
0.3.0-pre2a.title: 0.3.0 Prerelease 2A

0.3.0-pre3.description:
Quick release with the final features for this update. Full release probably later this weekend or early next week.

- Added Plasma Beam hint option
- Skipped the pause screen opening when defeating the Chozo Ruins Test
- Halved the time cutoffs for ending gallery rewards

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.3.0-pre2a...0.3.0-pre3
**Base patch**: https://github.com/lilDavid/MZM-Archipelago/compare/60aa30f...7472929
0.3.0-pre3.title: 0.3.0 Prerelease 3

0.3.1.description:
Quick patch for mainly the release of the Fusion world

- Added item sprites for Metroid Fusion items
- Adjusted Mother Brain combat logic (wave beam and screw attack -> any beam or screw attack)
- Corrected a small logic issue involving the Chozodia escape ship

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.3.0...0.3.1

0.4.0.description:
This update got entirely too large and took way too long to be finalized LOL

This update changes a bunch of options, so you'll need to make a new options file.

## New patcher
- Overhauled the patching system, item IDs, and client
- This should hopefully make the patcher more tolerant of different versions and the client more stable, especially with remote items
- The PopTracker pack won't be able to autotrack items until it gets updated

## New goal and shuffle options
- Metroid DNA goal
  - Mecha Ridley's door is locked until you collect enough Metroid DNA items
  - You can check the amount of DNA you have and need on the status screen
  - This is the default goal for now and likely will be going forward
  - Defaults to 5 needed/5 available like Fusion
- Fully powered suit shuffle
  - By default, you start with it as before, but the Chozo ruins test now gives you a random item
  - The shuffled item appears as one of the targets you need to shoot in the ruins test
- Shuffle or disable wall jumping
  - The shuffled item appears as a white Hi-Jump
- Shuffle Spring Ball separately from Hi-Jump
  - Sping Ball without Hi-Jump gives you the same jump height as a bomb jump

## Quality of life
- Reworked warp to start
  - Now accessed by pressing L on the map screen
  - Now resets your progress to the last time you saved
  - Now plays the appearance fanfare
- Added patches for some old rando gotchas
  - Landing site now always loads the post-Tourian version so the ballspark pickup is never fake
  - Also added the gunship to the post-Tourian landing site
  - Reworked the Power Grip tower room doors so the Power Grip location can be obtained by entering either door, and you can leave through either door immediately afterward.
  - Removed a tangle vine fruit that appeared near Varia Suit only after collecting the Hi-Jump location
  - Unlike the optional layout patches, these are always applied
- Added an option to reveal all hidden blocks
- Added an optional hint for Plasma Beam when you start the Chozodia stealth section
- The start with maps option now reveals the entire world map
- Crateria Water Speedway layout patch now also adjusts a tile in landing site so the gunship is reachable without items or wall jumps
- Added a Shinespark Puzzles location group

## Logic
- Added a leniency option to the hazard run logic
- The tricks that make up the logic options now have names and can be individually opted into and out of
- Separated a new tricky shinesparks option from advanced logic 
- Fixed potentially required softlocks for Norfair Ice Beam and Norfair Lower Right Shaft by Hi-Jump locations
- Various other adjustments

## Misc
- Changed the Nothing graphic to a tank with a question mark in it
- Updated some option descriptions
- Missile tanks use the new deprioritize flag from AP 0.6.3 and are now (mostly) excluded from progression balancing

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.3.1...0.4.0
**Basepatch**: https://github.com/lilDavid/MZM-Archipelago/compare/7472929...1fcd225

0.4.0-pre1.description:
This update's starting to get pretty big, so I'm gonna release this now to get some testing on what's already in:

- Overhauled the patching system, item IDs, and client
  - This should hopefully make the patcher more tolerant of different versions and the client more stable, especially with remote items
  - The PopTracker pack won't be able to autotrack items until it gets updated
- Added an option to shuffle your fully powered suit
  - By default, you start with it as before, but the Chozo ruins test now gives you a random item
  - Currently, the shuffled item appears as a fully powered Gravity Suit
- Added an option to shuffle or disable wall jumping
  - The shuffled item appears as a white Hi-Jump
- Added an option to shuffle Spring Ball separately from Hi-Jump
  - Sping Ball without Hi-Jump gives you the same jump height as a bomb jump
- Added an optional hint for Plasma Beam when you start the Chozodia stealth section
- The start with maps option now reveals the entire world map
- Added an option to reveal all hidden blocks
- Changed the Nothing graphic to a tank with a question mark in it
- Added a leniency option to the hazard run logic option
- The tricks that make up the logic options now have names and can be individually opted into and out of
- Updated some option descriptions
- Added a Shinespark Puzzles location group
- Missile tanks use the new deprioritize flag from AP 0.6.3 and are now (mostly) excluded from progression balancing
- Logic adjustments

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.3.0...0.4.0-pre1
0.4.0-pre1.title: 0.4.0 prerelease 1

0.4.0-pre2.description:
- Added Metroid DNA goal
  - Mecha Ridley's door is locked until you collect enough Metroid DNA items
  - You can check the amount of DNA you have and need on the status screen
  - This is the default goal for now and likely will be going forward
  - Defaults to 5 needed/5 available like Fusion
- Reworked warp to start
  - Now accessed by pressing L on the map screen
  - Now resets your progress to the last time you saved
  - Now plays the appearance fanfare
- Re-added conditional text for local tank items
- Crateria Water Speedway layout patch now also adjusts a tile in landing site so the gunship is reachable without items or wall jumps
- Added patches for some old rando gotchas
  - Landing site now always loads the post-Tourian version so the ballspark pickup is never fake
  - Also added the gunship to the post-Tourian landing site
  - Reworked the Power Grip tower room doors so the Power Grip location can be obtained by entering either door, and you can leave through either door immediately afterward.
  - Removed a tangle vine fruit that appeared near Varia Suit only after collecting the Hi-Jump location
  - Unlike the optional layout patches, these are always applied
- Fixed potentially required softlocks for Norfair Ice Beam and Norfair Lower Right Shaft by Hi-Jump locations
- Fixed revealed screw attack blocks being invisible
- Fixed Zero Suit being unable to wall jump without the item
- Fixed new items not updating the minimap when collected
- Fixed ruins test reward location changing the arena's map tile
- Fixed ruins test activating unknown items without the fully powered suit
- Fixed nothing item "animation"
- Fixed an issue introduced last prerelease where some missile tanks were duplicated in the item pool

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/0.4.0-pre1...0.4.0-pre2
0.4.0-pre2.title: 0.4.0 prerelease 2

0.4.1.description:
- Added world metadata for AP 0.6.4 and beyond
- Fixed gunship save not working after Mother Brain
- Fixed text wrapping in the Plasma Beam hint
- Fixed status screen display for ZSS

0.4.2.description:
* Fixed being unable to continue the game after saving and reloading at the gunship after Mother Brain
* Fixed being unable to pause after passing the Chozo ruins test
* Fixed buffed power bomb drops doubling the ammo drop's refill when turned off instead of on
* Fixed locked Chozodia option doing nothing
* Fixed the fully powered suit not activating when set to ruins test and having remote items on
* Updated the descriptions for a couple of options
* Fixed the world manifest incorrectly stating it's compatible with AP 0.6.3 (It actually only works with 0.6.4 and up)

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/Archipelago-Metroid-Zero-Mission/compare/2dd100b...57f3f20
**Basepatch Changelog**: https://github.com/lilDavid/MZM-Archipelago/compare/26080eb...0baa14e
